alert.note: Alert for Iredell; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 6:37PM EDT until June 19 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance to minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Iredell and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of a few secondary roads is ongoing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM EDT, A trained weather spotter is reporting water over a couple of secondary roads near NC 152 between Mooresville and China Grove. Doppler radar and automated gauges are reporting rainfall of 1-1.5 inches from recent thunderstorms with storm-total rainfall approaching 3 inches from heavy rainfall this morning. Additional isolated areas of nuisance to Minor flooding are possible as additional showers and thunderstorms are entering southern Iredell and southeast Rowan counties over the next 1-2 hours. These showers may produce another 0.50-1 inch of rainfall and may exacerbate ongoing flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mooresville, Davidson, Mount Ulla, and Doolie. -
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
